title: Cramer recommends buying these stocks after Thursday's brutal day on Wall Street
text: “In a tough market, you need to circle the wagons around the few good names you feel comfortable buying and then buying more if they go lower,” CNBC’s Jim Cramer said.

title: Facebook Has Failed at Stopping Disinformation, Techonomy Founder Says
text: David Kirkpatrick, founder of Techonomy, discusses presumptive Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden's call for Facebook to crack down on misinformation and fact-check political advertising ahead of the U.S. 2020 election. Kirkpatrick speaks on "Bloomberg Technology."

title: Facebook's Refusal to Crack Down on Trump Posts Could Move Ad Budgets Elsewhere
text: As Twitter waded into controversy for taking steps to fight misinformation and controversial remarks from perhaps its most famous tweeter, President Donald Trump, Facebook has taken the opposite tack, but with no less backlash.

title: Why Facebook Got Swept Up in the Market Sell-Off Today
text: Despite its strengths, the business is still sensitive to broader macroeconomic factors.

title: Tech's big five lost nearly $270 billion in value in Thursday's market crash
text: Shares of Apple dropped 4.8%, while Alphabet closed 4.29% lower. Facebook and Microsoft both lost more than 5% and Amazon dropped 3.38%.

title: Chris Cox returns to the fold as Facebook’s chief product officer
text: After a very high-profile departure and a year away from the company, Facebook’s former chief product officer Chris Cox will return to his long-held position with the company. Cox shared the news Thursday in a Facebook post with a photo of his company badge.

title: Facebook Brings Back a Former Top Lieutenant to Zuckerberg
text: Chris Cox, who quit Facebook last year after differences with the company’s chief executive, Mark Zuckerberg, is returning as chief product officer.

title: Facebook's former chief product officer is returning to fold; diversity head's role expanded
text: As several disgruntled Facebook Inc. FB, -5.53% employees quit in protest of the company's handling of incendiary posts from President Donald Trump, a familiar face is returning to the fold and another is being promoted.

title: Zuckerberg's former aide Chris Cox returns to Facebook as product head
text: Facebook Inc's  former chief product officer, Chris Cox, is returning to his role, according to his post https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=10105509261342903&set=a.692319249513&type=3&theater on the social media platform.

title: Chris Cox says he's returning to Facebook as chief product officer to 'dig in to help'
text: Cox left the company over a year ago amid disagreements with Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg.

title: Facebook's chief product officer returns after surprise departure a year ago
text: Long-time Facebook executive Chris Cox on Thursday announced his return to the social media company, saying he will resume his role as chief product officer.

title: Facebook’s chief diversity officer will now report directly to Sheryl Sandberg
text: Amid a heavier focus on race, diversity and inclusion in light of the police killing of George Floyd, an unarmed Black man, Facebook is making its chief diversity officer, Maxine Williams, report directly to COO Sheryl Sandberg, Sandberg wrote in a memo to Facebook employees today. Before, Williams reported to VP of Human Resources Janelle […]

title: Biden Calls To ‘Fix Facebook’ By Cracking Down Harder On Misinformation
text: Facebook replied that they would not reject campaign ads, which vibes with Trump's position that social media sites shouldn't fact check or censor.

title: Joe Biden calls on Facebook to change its policies before U.S. presidential election
text: Presumptive Democratic nominee Joe Biden called on Facebook to fix a number of its policies ahead of the 2020 U.S. presidential election.

title: Biden Readies Attack on Facebook’s Speech Policies
text: The campaign will urge its supporters to push the social media giant to strengthen its rules against misinformation and harmful comments.

title: Facebook Is Essential for Small Businesses
text: While small businesses are hurting, Facebook is their best bet to save themselves.

title: Is Antitrust a Real Threat to Facebook Stock?
text: Facebook Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) took another hit this week in its battle against antitrust allegations.

title: 4 Stocks To Buy To Invest in Virtual Reality
text: Sony, Facebook, and two other stocks will give investors a foothold in this nascent market.
